intro: Roeperocharis urbaniana, commonly known as the Urbaniana roeperocharis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Roeperocharis urbaniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
